description.narrative: Insatsen kommer att stödja den nationella processen för övergångsrättvisa i Jemen, från design till implementering, med särskilt utrymme för det civila samhället, organisationer för utsatta individer, och kommunikation samt spridning av information mellan formella processer och nationell dialog.

The project will support the national Transitional Justice process in Yemen from design through implementation, giving attention to civil society, victims' organisations and issues of communication and outreach between formal processes and national dialogue.

description.narrative:
The objective of the project was to establish a strong national platform to support nationally and locally driven transitional justice initiatives. The focus was to: 1) develop/strengthen national frameworks and institutions for redress (Ministry of Legal Affairs, Truth Commission, Commission of inquiry, the land and job dismissals commission, National Human Rights Institution etc). 2) strengthen CSOs for alternative avenues of redress and participation of victims 3) public outreach and national dialogue facilitation.
It is clear from the report that the deterioration of the security situation in Yemen from late 2014 severely affected the project implementation and that many of the objectives were not met. The truth commission was not established, the commission of inquiry was established in 2012 but never became operational. The Law on Transitional Justice and National Reconciliation was not adopted. The project organised a comprehensive consultation process on the initial draft, which was not in line with international standards, with the aim to re-develop the draft law. The consultation process was unique since it included all segments of society (500 participants) in a law making process which had never happened in Yemen before. It resulted in more than 100 recommendations on how to change the draft law but unfortunately no decision was taken on the law. Under the project many civil society organisations were strengthened in implementing conflict resolution/reconciliation activities within targeted local communities, provide psycho- social support and access to justice for victims of injustice, document violations of international law and awareness on human rights. Many outreach activities could not be carried out due to the security situation.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
